topic.title: Torrent搜索引擎 dht Torrent search Rats on The Boat
topic.body:
分散式搜索引擎无法阻止，因为它直接从此搜索引擎中的流量收集有关种子的信息90％来自世界各地的手

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1uPLoaDwKzP6MCGoVzw48r4pxawRBdmQc/data/users/1LGLe311PAqQm63B2A1MnFctPm8W25XC1i/Rats%20on%20The%20Boat%20linux%20windows.zip

https://github.com/DEgITx/rats-search/releases

topic.title: how to run zeronet as a tracker ?

1548112623_12cph6CWZ5WbjQwzbSGK2wEPDdrFu.body:
> [klu9](#comment_93_131Seivv6aH8vnohPmYPcPwPfZ1a5ubMMs): @toyata: I think PopcornTime was vulnerable because it had a focus on copyrighted content built right into the program, i.e. it specifically searched for YIFY movie rips (IIRC). But I think Rats (like most P2P) has a more defensible "users can do what they want with the program, it's not our fault if they choose copyrighted content ;)" approach that has allowed other filesharing programs to stay on Github and Sourceforge.But it would be nice to see more P2P programs hosted on a P2P platform like Gitcenter.

Yes, it would be nice to transfer the source code to getcenter
